intro: Melhania apiculata, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and erect. Melhania apiculata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
